speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Hey, you sure I can't help?

speaker: MARTHA CRITTENDON
line: Absolutely not. All set.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Oh, Martha, you make this look so easy.

speaker: MARTHA CRITTENDON
line: It's not too much, you think?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Are you kidding? This is just perfect. It's exactly the way I've always dreamt that Easter should be.

speaker: MICHELLE CRITTENDON
line: Mommy, mommy, look!

speaker: MARTHA CRITTENDON
line: Oh, good for you, Michelle.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: What you've done is really fabulous. The kids are going to remember this forever.

speaker: MARTHA CRITTENDON
line: I hope there are some things they won't remember. What is she doing here?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Her son is in Michelle's class, Martha. Be nice.

speaker: MARTHA CRITTENDON
line: Yeah.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Jenny, hi. It's good to see you.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: Hey, Ellen...

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: Martha.

speaker: MARTHA CRITTENDON
line: She's shaken up, Howard. It took me two hours to put her to bed.

speaker: MARTHA CRITTENDON
line: … … All I'm saying is... Well, no, I didn't see any bird but whatever it was it scared her and she wants to be with her daddy. That's all I'm saying. … Well, can't you come home one day early? …. A-a-all right, fine. I love you, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Anything?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. She'll come. Matter of time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Well, I hope you realize there's no evidence whatsoever that this mystery woman of yours has even committed a crime...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Though her wardrobe comes close.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah... Six prostitutes were seen with her at Dirty Dames never to be seen again. Not only might she be a female serial killer-- rare in and of itself-- but twice police raided that club to arrest her...

speaker: SCULLY
line: … and twice they came up empty-handed.

speaker: MULDER
line: She's on tape going in. The exits are covered. She's nowhere to be found. What happens to her? She disappear... turn invisible?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I hope we catch her, so she can tell us before I have to spend another night here. You know, Mulder, I don't know about you but I find this all very depressing... This round-the-clock exposure to the seamy underbelly.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's the job, Scully-- vigilance in the face of privation... the sheer will that it takes to sit in this crappy room spying on the dregs of society until our suspect surfaces. There's something ennobling in that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder. … Now? … All right.

speaker: MULDER
line: I got to go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: You wanted to see me, sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah, sit down.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Two weeks ago a woman named Martha Crittendon disappeared from her home in Bethany, Vermont. Local police haven't turned up any sign of her. I'm hoping you may be able to.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm already on a case.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're on a stakeout. I'm confident Agent Scully can continue in your absence.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? What did I do?

speaker: SKINNER
line: There may be aspects to this that... speak to your strengths as an investigator.

speaker: MULDER
line: Specifically?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Ravens. What do you know about them-- their mythological or... paranormal significance?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, the, uh... th-the raven is considered a-a very powerful symbol in certain Norse, Celtic and Native American cultures uh, mostly, a negative one. Indians view it as a deceiving spirit, Christianity mostly associates it with evil and, then, of course, there's Poe's raven and, "nevermore," an-and all that stuff.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Martha Crittendon's seven-year-old daughter claimed that she was attacked by a raven earlier the day her mother disappeared. Later, she heard one inside the house before she discovered her mother was missing.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, really, what did I do?

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's the only lead that hasn't been explored. I want to know if it has any bearing on the case. 8092 Cliff St. Bethany, Vermont 05032 802-555-0147

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm also assuming that the fact that Martha Crittendon's father is a federal judge also has a little bearing on this case.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's been made clear to me that locating her is my top priority. I'm making it yours as well.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Phil Adderly. Welcome to Bethany.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nice to meet you.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: I appreciate the help.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sure. Uh, I don't know how much help I'm going to be. I know you already have a lot of good investigators on the case. So, um... You want to just take a quick look around?

speaker: MULDER
line: Great, thanks.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, tell me about Martha Crittendon.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Well, she and my wife Ellen, they're best friends. Martha's... much admired here. She's devoted to her family... active in the community. I mean, needless to say, th-the whole town is very concerned.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, what's your theory on what happened?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: I'm hoping you'll tell me. There's no ransom note... no prints or blood evidence.

speaker: MULDER
line: Her husband was out of town when she disappeared?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: In Miami, at a conference. It checks out. Howard... didn't have anything to do with this.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you know about a raven?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Yeah, yeah, Michelle, their, um... their little girl was saying something about that. Got me. Poor kid. You want to talk to her?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not necessary.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're sure, uh, Martha's last name isn't Stewart?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Tell me about it. Last year, this place made the cover of New England Home.

speaker: MULDER
line: How many talons would you say a raven had?

speaker: MULDER
line: Never mind.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know what this is? You know what was hanging here?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: It was a mirror. It was found broken.

speaker: MULDER
line: You had no other signs of struggle?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Not a one. Does that mean something to you?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Howard, this is Agent Mulder with the FBI.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir. I hope we can help.

speaker: HOWARD CRITTENDON
line: I appreciate your coming. I'm wondering now if... this isn't just a waste of your time.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: How so?

speaker: HOWARD CRITTENDON
line: With all the police coming and going, this place was a wreck. I was straightening up and I... found something.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, birth control pills.

speaker: HOWARD CRITTENDON
line: I think Martha was having an affair. After Michelle we decided not to have more children. I had a vasectomy. They're in Martha's name. She ordered them off the Internet... because, I guess... small towns talk. Of course, then I s-started looking all around and I, uh... found this in the pocket of her favorite coat.

speaker: HOWARD CRITTENDON
line: I don't know what this goes to or what it means, if anything, but... the pills...

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you have any idea who your wife may have been seeing?

speaker: HOWARD CRITTENDON
line: Whoever he is... Martha may be with him. It explains why we haven't found her. She doesn't want to be found.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: Cute kid.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Oh, Jenny, you scared me.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: You do those up yourself?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Uh... yeah.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: I know Martha and you were good friends. You must be pretty upset.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Of course. I'm sure we all are. Hey, maybe you would like some of these to put up on your side of town.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: My side of town. Yeah, sure.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Look, I didn't mean that the way it might have sounded.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: No, it just naturally comes out that way when you think you're better than everyone. You and Martha are two peas in a pod.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Jenny, I don't think I'm better than anyone.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: You and me got more in common than you know.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Yeah. Right. Right. Thanks.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Whoever Martha was seeing the two of them covered their tracks pretty good. Phone records don't show anything. You think this person took her? Harmed her?

speaker: MULDER
line: I wouldn't rule it out, but I doubt it.

speaker: MULDER
line: According to your Audubon book here a raven has four talons. That matches the scratches we found on Martha Crittendon's mantel.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: You're not saying a raven's the reason Martha's gone missing?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no. Not... not a raven itself. But, in folklore, ravens are companions to evil-- evil spirits, witches, warlocks-- that kind of thing.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Agent Mulder, I appreciate the different tack you're taking on this investigation, but this whole bird thing...? And keep in mind you're basing this on the word of a seven-year-old girl.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, there was also a broken mirror in Martha's house. Mirrors are considered items of enchantment. A broken one … means something. I'm not exactly sure what it is, but it means something.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Ellen. Hey, sweet girl. Agent Mulder, this is my daughter Katy, my wife Ellen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Hi. Oh, we're so glad you're here. Look, our house is your house. We have a spare guest room all set up I'm sure you'll be really comfortable.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, that... that's not necessary.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: No, no, no. There's no arguments. We're so grateful that you're here to help find Martha. Really, it's the least we can do.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, I should really get the Bureau to reimburse you for room and board.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: No. Don't be silly. No, this is just a typical meal around here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Really?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Phil works so much that supper is usually the only time we see each other and I like to make it special.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh... Excuse me. Sorry. Thanks.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, please tell me I can go home.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, hey, Scully. How's the stakeout?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the furnace broke and I can just about see my breath in here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ouch. I'm sorry to hear that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That... and I've witnessed a couple hundred things I'd like to erase from my brain. Eww.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But as of yet, no mystery woman.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, she'll come, you know? It's just a matter of time. She'll show up-- I'm sure of that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, well not before I die of malnutrition.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully, tough it out. Whatever doesn't kill you makes you stronger. Right?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, no, no. No capers, thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry. What?

speaker: MULDER
line: I said, "What a... what a crazy caper." I'll talk to you later... and, uh, keep warm. Bye.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Did I hear you say something about "stakeout"? What's the case?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Sweetie, this is family time. Don't make our guest talk shop at the dinner table.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Fair enough.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Cheers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Cheers.

speaker: HOWARD CRITTENDON
line: What's the matter, Sweetheart? I thought that was your favorite.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: It tastes different when Mommy makes it.

speaker: HOWARD CRITTENDON
line: Yeah. I know. How about we go get hamburgers? Would you like that instead?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: It's back.

speaker: HOWARD CRITTENDON
line: Everything's all right, Sweetheart. I'll be right back.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you make of these claw marks?

speaker: DR. BLANKENSHIP
line: Well, one time I saw the victim of a bear attack look something like that … only bears don't plant their kill in the rose garden.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was going to say.

speaker: DR. BLANKENSHIP
line: The body's been around here for a while-- probably since she went missing.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: What about your ravens?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDDERLY
line: Howard said something about ravens.

speaker: DR. BLANKENSHIP
line: Yeah. Feeding on her. See?

speaker: MULDER
line: You okay?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: I'm not arresting Howard. I don't care how it looks-- body buried in his own yard-- he didn't do this.

speaker: MULDER
line: I agree.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Poor guy has suffered enough already.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: What are you doing? You shouldn't be here.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Oh, my God. Martha. No.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Ellen, honey, I am so sorry.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: It can't be.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: It's okay, it's okay. Shh.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: The thing that did that to her... I think I saw it today.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: I saw its reflection. It had a face out of a nightmare. These long claws-- the kind that could... the window shattered-- I don't know how-- and when I turned around, it was gone. I don't know what I thought it was. I didn't think it was real. I mean, how could it be? But then, when I saw Martha's face...

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Honey, you've been through a lot.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: You don't believe me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I do.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said the car window shattered after you saw the reflection and there's a broken mirror in Martha's house. I don't think that's a coincidence.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: But what could it mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mirrors are considered doorways. In the Victorian Era, they built mirrored rooms called psychomantiums where they thought they could summon forth spirits from the spirit world. Denizens from the spirit world were brought into this world.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Denizens... of the spirit world.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, you asked about the raven, right? The raven is a carrion bird attracted to death and decay. What if this entity that you saw is somehow a personification of that? What if this creature was brought forth in order to attack Martha? Then the question becomes, "who summoned it forth?" Ellen, do you know if Martha had any enemies? Can you think of anyone at all who would have wished her harm?

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: I sure as hell didn't have anything to do with it.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: They're routine questions, Ms. Uphouse. Answer them and we're out of here.

speaker: MULDER
line: We understand there was no love lost between you and Martha Crittendon.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: And where do you understand that from? Mrs. Sheriff, right?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: It's not exactly a town secret.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: Right. Like there aren't enough of those already. Queen Martha and her perfect little Easter egg hunts. She's so above the rest of us. Except I heard she was stepping out on her husband-- knocking boots with who knows who. I'm not happy she's dead, and all but you need to look into that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, let's stay on the subject of you. On your police record, for instance. You don't suffer people that don't give you respect. I'm thinking of that hair salon owner you assaulted.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: That was forever ago and I paid for that. And I had nothing to do with Martha.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where were you the night she disappeared?

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: At home, all night. I got to get back to work.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: I don't know about you, but I believe her. She didn't do it. I just don't get that vibe.

speaker: MULDER
line: Fair enough, but why did she lie about her alibi? I got that vibe pretty clear.

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: I'll be in the car.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, when you find me dead, my desiccated corpse propped up staring lifelessly through the telescope at drunken frat boys peeing and vomiting into the gutter just know that my last thoughts were of you and how I'd like to kill you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry. Who is this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a freak show, Mulder. It's a nonstop parade of every single lowlife imaginable.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, the view may not be too different here. It's dressed up a little nicer but underneath the surface, it's the same seamy underbelly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not the same, trust me.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, Scully, this case has turned out to be a little more interesting than I thought and I could use your help.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you talking about a reprieve for me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, there's a murder victim that I'd like you to autopsy for me. What do you think? Scully? You still there? Hello?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That van is back.

speaker: MULDER
line: What? What did you say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing, Mulder. I'll talk to you later, okay?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Kat...

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Get away from her! It's okay. Come on.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Shh, shh, shh. Be quiet, now. Shh, shh, shh. Shh, shh, shh, be quiet.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Oh, God. Ellen? Ellen, what happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you feeling a little better, Ellen? Can you... just talk to me a little bit about what happened?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: It came back.

speaker: MULDER
line: It came back-- the... the creature you saw?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: It was here, Phil. It chased me.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: It's all right, Honey.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Please don't encourage this. This is not what she needs.

speaker: MULDER
line: I believe she saw something.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: And I believe she didn't. Her best friend just died, for God's sake. These imaginings of hers are brought on by stress. I have been through the entire house and I didn't see any indication that anyone else was here.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about the two broken mirrors?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: What about them? You think broken mirrors have some deeper meaning but you still can't tell me what it is. And in this case? I'm thinking Ellen broke them herself.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's number six. It's a match to the one Howard Crittendon found in his wife's coat pocket. What would this be doing here?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ellen, do you recognize this key?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Well, I was sweeping the floor and it got caught up in the sweeper. I-I... never saw it before today.

speaker: MULDER
line: You found it before you were attacked?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Right before. Right before I saw the raven.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Let me see if my department can run this down, find out what lock it goes to.

speaker: (LATER. 12
line: 38 AM. ADDERLY's bedroom. PHIL gets out of bed and leaves.)

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: Hi.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: I can't do this anymore.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: You can't, huh?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: No. We got to stop.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: Well, that's too bad.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, hey-- good morning. Good morning, Ellen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wow... Uh, have you seen my shirt? I left it...

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Oh, I'm sorry. It's over here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh. Oh, Ellen, you-you didn't have to go to the trouble of...

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: No, it's no trouble. Actually, it helps me. Whenever my life's a mess, I just do some housework. It gives me the illusion I'm in control.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe I should try that sometime.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Hey, have a seat.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks. Yikes. Wow...

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: It's just Phil's breakfast times two.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, Phil is living large. Where is he this morning?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Out-- probably out on a call. He'll be back. You... you can just dig in.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whoa.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Sorry. Do you need milk?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh-uh. That's fine.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: I get the feeling you're not used to anyone taking care of you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that has a vaguely pathetic ring to it.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: No, I just meant I didn't notice a wedding band.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Do you have a... a significant other?

speaker: MULDER
line: Um, not in the widely understood definition of that term.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Ah. Well, the right woman will come along and change all that. Don't miss out on home and family, Mr. Mulder. With all the terrible things you must see in your work-- well, it could be a refuge for you.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Hi, Honey.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Sorry I'm late-- paperwork. Good morning, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good morning.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: I'm going to go check on Katy.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: You sleep well?

speaker: MULDER
line: Eh, I only woke up once, when you went out.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Well, I'll try to be quieter next time. We got a deputy out-- we're shorthanded. I had to take some calls.

speaker: MULDER
line: All night?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Yeah. We were busy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I spoke to the coroner this morning and the autopsy shows that Martha Crittendon was four weeks pregnant when she died-- despite her birth control pills. She probably didn't even know it. Any idea who the father might be? I mean, Howard's vasectomy pretty much puts him out of the running. Any inkling who it might be?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Just say what's on your mind, Agent.

speaker: MULDER
line: You have a piece of evidence in your possession that I'd like back-- the skeleton key. Number six.

speaker: MULDER
line: You want to tell me what this unlocks?

speaker: MULDER
line: Once I find out, we'll talk again.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: I'm going to hit the shower.

speaker: JENNY UPHOUSE
line: I know, Bret, sweetie. I'm sorry. No, I'm going to be home real soon. Mommy had to work a double shift. I know. I'm going to come home and make you breakfast. I know... No, no, no, don't eat a lot of cookies, no. Only two. I... Yes, oatmeal cookies have oatmeal in them. Okay, all right, three. I love you. Bye.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sheriff, you know that talk I said we should have?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: I left her sleeping.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you were having an affair with both Jenny and Martha Crittendon? I got to hand it to you, Sheriff. You put the service back into "protect and serve."

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: I cared about both of them.

speaker: MULDER
line: They knew about each other? But I'm assuming Ellen doesn't.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: No. But even if she did, she'd find a way to rationalize it. I'm not defending myself, but... two years ago I wanted a divorce. Ellen won't hear it. She got pregnant with Katie and locked me up good.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I think you got bigger problems facing you right now.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: I didn't do this, I swear to you. Anyway, what about the broken mirrors and the raven? Y-you said that it was a-an entity that did this. Don't you still believe that?

speaker: MULDER
line: I said it was an entity summoned by somebody else....

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Whether or not they even knew about it. I mean, is that possible? Can I be the reason for all this... and not even know about it?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Hi, you've reached the Adderlys-- Phil, Ellen and Katy. Please leave a message.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Ellen, this is Phil. I was really hoping you'd be home. Look, I'm in a bit of a situation here and there's things we need to talk about but Agent Mulder's on his way over there to explain it all to you so if you get this message you just wait there for him, okay? Thanks.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: I think this sleepy little girl needs a nap. I sure do. Are you eating mama's jacket?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Go to sleep now. Okay, baby? Mama loves you. I love you. Yes, I do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ellen? Ellen?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? I am free.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're free?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm-hmm. I'm going to go home, take a shower for, I don't know eight or nine hours, burn the clothes that I'm wearing and then... sleep until late spring.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, you solved the X-File.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, except it's not an X-File, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you saying? You didn't catch our blond mystery serial killer?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, no, we caught her, but she isn't a serial killer nor is she a blonde, and she isn't even a she.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What I'm talking about is the six missing prostitutes aren't dead, Mulder. They are alive and well in a halfway house that was set up by this mystery blond who happens to go by the name of Mark Scott Egbert and Mr. Egbert wishes to acquaint lost souls with the teachings of Christ and that's his hook, I guess. He dresses up like a fellow prostitute to make the girls feel at ease but this vanishing act is no more paranormal than a change of wardrobe, Mulder. He goes into a place like a, like a woman and he comes out as a man, right under...

speaker: MULDER
line: …. our noses.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Exactly. A wolf in sheep's clothing or I guess, in this case, a sheep in wolf's clothing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, good work, Scully. I'll call you back later.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ellen? Ellen, it's Agent Mulder.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Please go away.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ellen, Jenny Uphouse is dead. Your husband is in custody suspected of murdering her only I don't think he did it. Do you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ellen, you went out this morning after breakfast. Where'd you go?

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: It's not me. It can't be.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think it is. Ellen, I think you have a whole other side that you're afraid to face. That would explain all the broken mirrors. You don't want to see yourself for what you really are. Ellen, you have to come out of there.

speaker: ELLEN ADDERLY
line: Then what? My marriage, my life... everything I thought I had... is nothing. It's all lies. I wish you'd never come here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ellen, you need to open this door.

speaker: MULDER
line: You want to see her?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Does she want to see me?

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Doctors say she's got some kind of... dissociative disorder, split personality. That doesn't explain what happened, does it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think it's about as close as science can come. I think the basic idea is right. There are some multiple personality disorders where an alternate personality displays traits that the host doesn't have-- like nearsightedness or high blood pressure or even diabetes. I think in Ellen's case the changes were just a lot more extreme.

speaker: SHERIFF PHIL ADDERLY
line: Like Jekyll and Hyde?

speaker: MULDER
line: She wanted so much from her life with you-- a perfect life-- and I think that at some point she found out you were cheating with Jenny and Martha, I don't know when, but at some point she did, and... and, like you said, I think she had to rationalize that. She just bottled up her anger, swallowed it, and it had to come out some way. I think she did what she did to protect her family.
